result.execSummary:
The defendant James Terrell Shoemaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with Brown Deer High School or Middle School. No contact with Monique R. Defendant to have no contact with Monique R. during the entire length of the sentence.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample for the Department of Corrections and pay the surcharge. Pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
Obtain high school diploma or equivalency.
Sex offender treatment as recommended. As to the issue of registering as a sex offender:  Court leaves that to be determined by the Department of Corrections and up to their authority.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   State advises the Court they have complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, James S. and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction - sraight time - with 1 day credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) no contact with Brown Deer High School or Middle School; 4) obtain high school diploma or equivalency; 5) sex offender treatment as recommended; 6) no contact with Monique R.; 7) perform 100 hours of community service. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample for the Department of Corrections and pay the surcharge;
- defendant to have no contact with Monique R. during the entire length of the sentence.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As to the issue of registering as a sex offender:  Court leaves that to be determined by the Department of Corrections and up to their authority. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant James Terrell Shoemaker in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case transferred forthwith from Br. 12 for plea and sentencing.  Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charge to Fourth Degree Sexual Assault 940.225(3m) a Class A misdemeanor.
Br 12 is in trial.  Br 44 agreed to hear this matter for Br 12.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant James Terrell Shoemaker in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for plea hearing.  Defense recently received an offer and request a short adjournment in order to discuss this matter further with the defendant.  If the matter does not resolve at the next court date, it will be scheduled for jury trial.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-26-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Terrell Shoemaker in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for plea hearing.  Parties request an adjournment.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-10-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Terrell Shoemaker in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Christopher A. Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is scheduled for Scheduling Conference. 
Discovery received. Case adjourned to Br. 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Bail motion by the State argued and granted by the Court.  Court AMENDS No Contact Order to include the Brown Deer Middle School.

Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set; including the No Contact Order.

Defendant James Terrell Shoemaker in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Christopher A. Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 12.
Clerk:  jms
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MDR and Brown Deer High School.

Defendant James Terrell Shoemaker in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
